pubinfo.publish: United States. Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Office of Geographic Information Services

descript.abstract: This point shapefile is a geographic point database of aircraft landing facilities in the United States and U.S. Territories. Attribute data is provided on the physical and operational characteristics of the landing facility, current usage including enplanements and aircraft operations, congestion levels and usage categories. This geospatial data is derived from the FAA's National Airspace System Resource Aeronautical Data Product.
descript.purpose: The dataset provides users with information about airport locations and attributes and can be used for national and regional analysis applications.

cntorgp.cntorg: Federal Aviation Administration (Aeronautical Information Services, ATA-100)

idinfo.datacred: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) develops and maintains the textual data from which this geospatial layer was derived.

citeinfo.title: National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2011

pubinfo.publish: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transporation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

attracc.attraccr: Airport attributes were obtained from the Federal Aviation Administration's (FAA) National Airspace System Resource Aeronautical Data and the Office of Airline Information (OAI) Enplanement Data. The FAA Data was published by the Aeronautical Information Services with an Effective Date of March 10, 2011. All records were assigned the accurate state name, state abbreviation and FIPS code.

dataqual.logic:
All point records in this dataset are represented by a single coordinate pair and two unique feature identifiers -- the landing facility location identifier (LOCID) and the site number (SITE_NO) assigned by the FAA.
BTS quality checks were to cross reference the place dataset with the state dataset, to determine that the spatial data and attribute data were accurate.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is based on coordinate data provided in the FAA National Airspace System Resource Aeronautical Dataset. These coordinate data identify the approximate location of the Airport Reference Point (ARP) as reported by the landing facility on the NFDC (National Flight Data Center) 5010 form. According to NFDC guidelines, the location of the ARP should be reported to a horizontal accuracy of one arc second of latitude and longitude. However, the accuracy of these reported coordinates are not verified by FAA. The records were loaded into a GIS and checked for any unusual or obviously erroneous locations.

srcinfo.srccontr: Data were obtained from the Federal Aviation Administration's (FAA) National Airspace System Resource Aeronautical Data. This product was published by the Aeronautical Information Services.

procstep.procdesc: The creation of this geospatial data layer was completed by RITA/BTS in March 2011. This Shapefile was built from textual data on the FAA National Airspace System Resource Aeronautical Data CDROM, effective March 10, 2011.

cntperp.cntorg: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

procstep.procdesc: In order to meet Tufts University's metadata standards: >Changed citation title from "airports" to "Airports USA 2011" >Changed access contraints from "None" to "Unrestricted Access Online" >Changed name of file from "airports" to "USAairports11" >Changed originators/publishers from "Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)" and "Federal Aviation Administration (Aeronautical Information Services, ATA-100)" to "United States. Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Office of Geographic Information Services" and "United States. Federal Aviation Administration" >Changed publication places to reflect LCNH formatting >Added theme keyword "point" to added theme keyword thesaurus "FGDC" >Added ISO 19115 Topic Category keywords >Added LCSH theme keywords >Added GNIS and GNS place keywords >Replaced Tufts as the distributor >Exported metadata

enttyp.enttypd: Airports of the United States and its territories in GIS format.
enttyp.enttypds: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.

edom.edomvd: Point Shapes as defined by ArcView

attr.attrdef: A unique identifying number followed by an asterisk and the 'landing facility type' code. The SITE_NO forms the key to the airport records in the NFDC (5010) database. Example: 04508.*A

codesetd.codesetn: List of Official Airport Site Numbers

attr.attrdef: Landing Facility Type

edom.edomvd: Short Take Off and Landing Facility

attr.attrdef: A unique 3-4 character identifier assigned to the landing facility (i.e. airport).

codesetd.codesetn: List of Official LOC ID Codes

attr.attrdef: Information Effective Data (MM/DD/YYYY). This date coincides with the 56-day charting and publication cycle date.
FAA Region where the facility is located
FAA District or Field Office Code

codesetd.codesetn: List of Official FAA District and Field Office Codes

attr.attrdef: State Postal abbreviation, as coded by RITA/BTS

codesetd.codesetn: Official List of U.S. Postal Code Abbreviations

attr.attrdef: The 2-character FIPS code of the State or State equivalent, as coded by RITA/BTS

codesetd.codesetn: Codes for the Identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the Outlying Areas of the United States, and Associated Areas, FIPS 5-2.
codesetd.codesets: U.S. Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: State Postal abbreviation, as coded by FAA

codesetd.codesetn: Official List of U.S. Postal Code Abbreviations

attr.attrdef: Airport's associated state or territory name, as coded by FAA.

codesetd.codesetn: Official List of U.S. States and Territories

attr.attrdef: Name of the county or parish associated with the airport, as coded by FAA.

codesetd.codesetn: Official List of U.S. County and Parish Names

attr.attrdef: Associated county's state (post office code) state where the associated county is located; may not be the same as the associated city's state code, as coded by FAA.

codesetd.codesetn: Official List of U.S. State Names

attr.attrdef: Name of the city associated with the airport, as coded by FAA.
Official Airport Name
Type of Airport Facility Owner
Facility Use -- Public or Private
City, State, and Zip code associated with the airport.
The latitude of the point expressed as a signed real number. This value is in decimal degrees with negative values indicating South latitude and positive values indicating North latitude.
The longitude of the point expressed as a signed real number. This value is in decimal degrees with negative values indicating West longitude and positive values indicating East longitude.
Elevation in feet at the highest point on the centerline of the useable landing surface. Measured to the nearest foot with respect to mean sea level (MSL).
Aeronautical chart on which the airport facility appears.
Distance from the central business district of the associated city to the airport in nautical miles (1 nautical mile = 6,080 feet). Measured to the nearest nautical mile
Direction of airport from the central business district of the associated city. Measured to the nearest 1/8 compass point
Identifies the month and year that the facility was added to the NFDC airport database - only available for facilities opened since 1981 (MM/YYYY).
Airport Certification Type and Date - The format is a two-character code followed by a month/year (MM/YYYY) of certification.

edom.edomvd: Landing facilities having a full certificate under FAR Part 139 and receiving scheduled air carrier service from carriers certified by the Civil Aeronautics Board. The A, B, C, D, E identifies the aircraft rescue and fire fighting index for the landing facility, and the 'S' is for scheduled air carrier service.

Landing facilities having a full certificate under FAR Part 139 and receiving scheduled air carrier service from carriers certified by the Civil Aeronautics Board. The A, B, C, D, E identifies the aircraft rescue and fire fighting index for the landing facility, and the 'S' is for scheduled air carrier service.

Landing facilities having a full certificate under FAR Part 139 and receiving scheduled air carrier service from carriers certified by the Civil Aeronautics Board. The A, B, C, D, E identifies the aircraft rescue and fire fighting index for the landing facility, and the 'S' is for scheduled air carrier service.

Landing facilities having a full certificate under FAR Part 139 and receiving scheduled air carrier service from carriers certified by the Civil Aeronautics Board. The A, B, C, D, E identifies the aircraft rescue and fire fighting index for the landing facility, and the 'S' is for scheduled air carrier service.

Landing facilities having a full certificate under FAR Part 139 and receiving scheduled air carrier service from carriers certified by the Civil Aeronautics Board. The A, B, C, D, E identifies the aircraft rescue and fire fighting index for the landing facility, and the 'S' is for scheduled air carrier service.
Landing facilities having a full certificate under FAR Part 139 but not currently receiving scheduled service.
Landing facilities having a full certificate under FAR Part 139 but not currently receiving scheduled service.
Landing facilities having a full certificate under FAR Part 139 but not currently receiving scheduled service.
Landing facilities having a full certificate under FAR Part 139 but not currently receiving scheduled service.
Landing facilities having a full certificate under FAR Part 139 but not currently receiving scheduled service.
Landing facilities having limited certification under FAR Part 139 and receiving scheduled air carrier service.
Landing facilities having limited certification under FAR Part 139 and not currently receiving scheduled air carrier service.
'N' or a blank indicates the facility is not certified.

attr.attrdef: NASP/ Federal Agreement Code - a combination of 1 to 7 codes that indicate the type of federal agreements existing at the airport.

edom.edomvd: National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems (NPIAS)
Installation of Navigational Facilities on privately owned airports under F&E program
Compliance with accessibility to the handicapped
Surplus property agreement under Public Law 289
Conveyance under Section 16, Federal Airport Act of 1946 or Section 23, Airport and Airway Development Act of 1970
Assurances pursuant to Title VI, Civil Rights Act of 1964
Conveyance under Section 303(C), Federal Aviation Act of 1958
Grant agreement has expired; however, agreement remains in effect as long as it is a public use facility
Section 303(C) Authority from FAA Act of 1958 has expired; however, agreement remains in effect as long as it is a public use facility
AP-4 Agreement under DLAND or DCLA has expired

attr.attrdef: Customs international airport - Whether the landing facility has been designated by the U.S. Treasury as an international airport of entry for customs.

Customs Landing Rights Airport - Whether the landing facility has been designated by the U.S. Treasury as a customs landing rights airport (some landing facilities may have these rights for cargo only).
Joint Use - Whether the landing facility has a military/civil joint use agreement that allows civil operations at a military airport or military operations at a civil airport.
Military Landing Rights - Whether the airport has entered into an agreement that grants landing rights to the military.

Military Emergency Interest - Military department(s) that maintains national emergency use interest in this civil facility. Data values in this field are one, two, or three alphanumeric codes indicating military emergency use interest, with each code in a series separated by a '/'.

edom.edomvd: None [applicable only where there is an entry in the National Emergency * Status [NAT_EMER] Field]

attr.attrdef: Airport Control Tower located on the airport.
Based Single Engine General Aviation Aircraft
Based Multi-engine general aviation aircraft
Based Jet engine general aviation aircraft
Based Helicopters - General Aviation
Base Operational Gliders - general aviation
Based Military Aircraft - including helicopters
Based Ultralight aircraft - general aviation
Commercial Services - scheduled operations by CAB certified carriers or intrastate carriers and any scheduled commuter/cargo carriers (Annual Operations).
Air Taxi operators carrying passengers, mail, or mail for revenue (Annual Operations).
General Aviation, Local Operations - Those operating in the local traffic pattern or within a 20 mile radius (Annual Operations).
General Aviation - Itinerant Operations. Those general aviation operations (excluding commuter or air taxi) not qualifying as local (Annual Operations).
Military Aircraft Operations (Annual Operations).
The VERSION is a 2-digit number that will be incremented for all records in the database whenever a new release is distributed.
